alert.note: Alert for Butte; Meade (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 6:30PM MDT until June 23 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Butte County in northwestern South Dakota... North central Meade County in west central South Dakota... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 630 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Owl Butte, or 33 miles northeast of Sturgis, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Butte and north central Meade Counties to the south of Mud Butte. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for northwestern and west central South Dakota.
